page.title: 20CIRENCESTER JUNIOR SCHOOL
page.content: Cirencester County Junior School serves the immediate areas around Victoria Road and also takes a few out of town children.It occupies the buildings which formed the old Grammar School.There are 250 pupils,10 full- time teaching staff and a part-time remedial teacher.Most children wear the school uniform:grey skirt/trousers white shirt,red tie.There are rooms for music,art,T.V.,pottery, as well as a hall, library and 10 classrooms.All classes have a computer in their room. Use of the large field behind the school is shared with the County Infant School which is on the same site.Secretarial and caretaking work is also shared.Opposite is the Bingham Hall which is occasionally used for concerts.
